PATRICK MCKEAGE
BAY PINES CENTER
2425 N. 30TH STREET,
ESCANABA, MI, 49829-9203
Re: License #: CS210200969
Special Investigation #: 2024C0000843SI
Dear Mr. McKeage:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behaviors, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During unknown dates, youth was physically injured during
restraints, including dislocated shoulder, chipped chin, and
bruising.
Other youth have been put in chokeholds where they are unable
to breathe and had their arms broken. Previously investigation
under SIR2019C0102035 and SIR2020C0102002
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on October 11,
2023, and reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at Pine Rest facility, on
October 12, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth A said he has been placed at Bay Pines Center on four
occasions over the past six or seven years. Youth A stated the
youth that had been in choke holds and broken arms was when he
was placed at Bay Pines in 2018 and 2019 [SIR2019C0102035
and SIR2020C0102002]. Youth A denied ever having his shoulder
dislocated while placed at Bay Pines Center. Youth A said “two
placements ago” he was restrained by Staff 3 and Supervisor Y.
Youth A said during the restraint he tripped Supervisor Y which
made Supervisor Y fall. Staff 3 secured both of Youth A’s arms and
they also tripped and fell overtop of Supervisor Y. When they
landed, Youth A said he hit his face on the ground because Staff 3
was holding his arms so he could not catch himself. Youth A said
he chipped his “chin” during that fall and was provided a Band-Aid
and saw the nurse three days later. Youth A said during his most
recent placement at Bay Pines Center he was restrained by Staff
4, Supervisor X, and Group Leader. Youth A said during this
2

restraint Staff 4, Supervisor X and Group Leader took him to the
ground. On the way down he was resisting the hold. When they
laid him down, he banged his head on the ground and stated, “it
was probably my fault that I banged my head backward on the
floor”. Youth A said Staff 4, Supervisor X, and Group Leader stood
him up right away and placed him against the wall and put
handcuffs on his wrists which were tight and walked him back to
his room. Youth A said once he was in his room, he kicked Group
Leader. Staff left him in the handcuffs and shut the door. Youth A
said he was upset they shut the door and he hit his head off his
bedroom door window. Youth A said he was then placed on
concussion protocol.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth
B said Youth A was placed at Bay Pines Center with her twice over
the last few years. Youth B said Youth A would self-harm, threaten
to hurt youth and staff, assault staff, and destroy property
frequently. Youth B said she has witnessed Youth A in restraints
and felt they always looked appropriate and did not have any
concerns about the way in which staff restrained Youth A. Youth B
said Youth A talked to her frequently and she denied him ever
telling her that he was hurt during a restraint. Youth B said she has
never seen any youth with broken bones from restraints.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker.
Youth C said Youth A would participate on her unit while he was
placed at Bay Pines Center. Youth C said Youth A was aggressive
and would threaten to hurt some of the youth, threatened to kill
Staff 2, was assaultive towards all staff, and would break items in
the facility. Youth C said she witnessed Youth A restrained one
time while he was standing up and she did not feel like the staff
did anything wrong during the restraint. Youth C said she has
never heard Youth A complain of staff hurting him during restraints
or any other time.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth D said Youth A was on her unit. Youth D said Youth A was
“not all the way there” and would say scary things such as wanting
to kill, hurt, and rape people. Youth D said Youth A had threatened
Youth F on several occasions. Youth D said Youth A would break a
lot of items around the facility including a phone and window.
Youth D said staff would restrain Youth A “a lot” due to his
behaviors. Youth D said she saw staff restrain Youth A against the
3

wall but was unable to remember which staff or when it occurred.
Youth D said she never heard Youth A say he was hurt by a staff.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth E said Youth A was placed on her unit. Youth E said Youth A
would become very angry when he was told “no or not right now”.
Youth E said Youth A would threaten youth and staff frequently,
most recently threatening to kill Staff 2, and hurt Staff 5 and Youth
C. Youth E said Youth A will also become upset and break the
property in the facility, including a phone, computer, and a door.
Youth E said she witnessed Youth A restrained two times, one
standing and one on the ground. Youth E said she did not see any
concerns with the restraints and never heard Youth A say he was
hurt after the restraints.
Youth F was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth F said Youth A was on her unit. Youth F said Youth A was
destructive and broke things on the unit and in the classroom.
Youth F said Youth A would be “fine when he was in a good
mindset” but then “target staff when he got upset”. Youth F said
she witnessed Youth A in “a couple” restraints. Youth F said Youth
A was never on the ground and typically staff would just move
Youth A to his hallway or room and let him go. Youth F said she
never was concerned how staff were holding Youth A during the
restraints. Youth F said Youth A was never hurt to her knowledge
and Youth A never complained of being injured.
Nurse and Nurse Practitioner were interviewed face-to-face at
the facility, on October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the
MDHHS worker. Nurse and Nurse Practitioner said they do not
recall ever seeing Youth A for an injury due to a restraint and youth
are all seen each youth after each restraint.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Therapist said she worked directly with Youth A and would see him
several times throughout the week due to his high level of mental
health needs. Therapist said she has never seen Youth A injured
due to a restraint. Therapist denied Youth A ever telling her he was
injured during a restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on October
17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said
he worked with Youth A on and off but was not on the same unit as
4

him. Staff 1 said he felt he had a good relationship with Youth A.
Staff 1 said he only witnessed one restraint with Youth A in March
2023 after Youth A punched a staff. Staff 1 said the restraint only
lasted a brief period and was a standing hold. Staff 1 said Youth A
was not injured after the restraint. Staff 1 said he has never seen
or heard of Youth A being injured during a restraint. Staff 1 said
Youth A had broken his hand after punching a door but that was
the only broken bone he is aware of with Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on October
17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Supervisor
Z was interviewed via telephone, on October 23, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Supervisor and Staff 2 said
they are not aware of Youth A being injured as a result of
restraints. Staff 2 and Supervisor said Youth A never disclosed to
them being harmed by any staff member.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on October
17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said
he had been involved in restraints with Youth A during the multiple
times he has been placed at Bay Pines Center. Staff 3 said
sometime in 2020 he and Supervisor Y were escorting Youth A to
his room and Youth A tripped Supervisor Y and they all fell to the
ground with Youth A hitting his chin on the floor. Staff 3 said he
does not recall Youth A having any cut or need for medical as a
result of that incident. Staff 3 said he has no knowledge of Youth A
being injured from any other restraint or escort while at Bay Pines
Center.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on October
17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 4 said
he was involved in two restraints with Youth A during his most
recent placement at Bay Pines Center. Staff 4 said on June 26,
2023, Youth A was restrained at the facility and at the hospital and
he was involved in both incidents. Staff 4 said Youth A was putting
tea tree oil from a small glass bottle into the scent diffuser and
threw it on the ground and once it was broken took a piece of the
glass and put it in his mouth. Staff 4 said he immediately put Youth
A into a hold in order to get the glass. He has significant self-harm
issues and wanted to make sure he got the glass out of Youth A’s
mouth, and out of his reach. Staff 4 said other staff arrived to help
him with the situation and placed Youth A in mechanical restraints.
Staff 4 said Youth A finally spit the glass out of his mouth about ten
minutes later. He began to bang his head on the wall in front of
him so he and Group Leader escorted him to his bedroom to get
away from the wall and the glass. Staff 4 said once in his room the
5

mechanical restraints were removed and Youth A kicked Group
Leader as he and Staff 4 were walking out of the room and shut
the door. Staff 4 said Youth A did not have any injury from that
restraint however staff contacted poison control due to Youth A
having the tea tree oil bottle in his mouth. They were directed to
take him to the emergency room for an evaluation. Staff 4 said
staff entered Youth A’s room and placed him in mechanical
restraints for both his hands and legs for the transport to the
hospital. Staff 4 said once at the hospital Youth A was non-
compliant and was attempting to AWOL from the waiting area and
was threatening hospital staff. Staff 4 said the hospital security
was called and they made the decision to place Youth A in a
wheelchair with additional restraints for safety of Youth A and
others at the hospital. Staff 4 said he witnessed that situation but
did not assist as the hospital security staff had taken over. Staff 4
said Youth A was not hurt during that incident and saw the doctor
after both of these incidents and did not have any injuries. Staff 4
said he has no knowledge of any other restraints causing injury to
Youth A.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone, on October 23, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 5 said he was
involved in a restraint with Youth A when he was placed two times
ago, but never during his most recent placement period. Staff 5
said he does not recall all the details from the restraint but does
not remember any injury with Youth A as a result of the restraint.
Staff 5 said he is not aware of Youth A being injured at any time
due to restraints.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone, on November 1, 2023,
in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 6 said he was
Youth A’s group staff and worked with him frequently. Staff 6 said
he was never involved in any restraints with Youth A and only
witnessed one occasion when Staff 3 held Youth A in a supportive
stance after Youth A had banged his head on a window and
cracked the window. Staff 6 said Youth A had a small cut on his
forehead from this incident, however it was not from the restraint
rather him hitting his head on the window. Staff 6 said he never
saw Youth A injured from a restraint, and Youth A never disclosed
being injured from staff.
Group Leader was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Group Leader said he responded to an assistance call on June
26, 2023. When he arrived Youth A was by the sink with glass in
his mouth and Staff 4 was holding his arms talking to him. Group
6

Leader said he assisted by talking with Youth A and encouraging
him to spit out the glass and about twenty-five minutes later he
finally spit it out. Group Leader said he assisted in walking Youth A
to his room by lightly holding one of his arms. Group Leader said
Youth A had on mechanical restraints and once Youth A was in his
room they were removed and as he and Staff 4 were walking out
of the room Youth A kicked him. Group Leader said he remembers
closing Youth A’s door and then going back to his unit and allowing
the supervisor to take over the next steps for Youth A. Group
Leader said Youth A was not injured during that restraint. Group
Leader said he has no knowledge of Youth A being injured in any
other restraint.
Supervisor Y was interviewed via telephone, on October 30,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Supervisor Y
said he was not involved in any restraints during Youth A’s
placement this time, however, does recall one he was involved in
during one of Youth A’s prior placement periods. Supervisor Y said
he was escorting Youth A to his room, however, was unable to
remember the reason why, and Youth A “mule kicked” him in the
shin and he tripped and fell to the ground with Youth A and the
other staff falling as well. Supervisor Y said when Youth A fell, he
his hit chin on the ground and had a small abrasion that was
bleeding therefore basic first aid was administered and he was
fine. Supervisor Y said he has no knowledge of any other injury
Youth A had received from a restraint.
MDHHS Employee was interviewed via telephone, on October
31, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. MDHHS
Employee said she was hired through Macomb County to provide
one-on-one supervision with Youth A. MDHHS Employee said she
worked with Youth A from September 1, 2023, until Youth A left the
facility on September 17, 2023. MDHHS Employee said she would
be at the facility from 3:30pm until 10:00pm on weekdays, and
between 12 and 16 hours on the weekend. MDHHS Employee
said she never witnessed Youth A being restrained during her time
at the facility. MDHHS Employee said she never saw Youth A
injured and he never told her he was injured by any of the staff at
Bay Pines Center.
Director was interviewed via telephone, on November 13,
2023. Director said he is not aware of any restraints causing Youth
A injury. Director said through the restraint notification process
they have in place he would have been informed if Youth A was
injured during a restraint.
7

Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report 151810201 dated March 29, 2023, for
Youth A. The incident report documents the restraint that
occurred by Staff 3 due to Youth A banging his head on a
window causing it to break. The only injury from the
restraint was a cut on Youth A’s forehead due to him
breaking the window with his head, no injury from the staff.
• Incident Report 157560204 dated June 26, 2023, for Youth
A. The incident report documents the restraint that occurred
by Staff 4 and Group Leader when Youth A broke a tea tree
glass bottle and put the glass in his mouth. The incident
report is consistent with Staff 4 and Group Leader’s
interviews. Youth A banged his head on the wall while in the
restraint, however no injury was noted from the staff. Youth
A was brought to the emergency room for medical attention
due to banging his head and to check for poison in his
system due to placing the tea tree oil bottle in his mouth.
• Incident Report 157670204 dated June 26, 2023, for Youth
A. The incident report documents the restraint at the
emergency room by the emergency room security officers.
There are no injuries documented as a result of the
restraint.
• Incident Report 158040204 dated July 3, 2023, for Youth A.
The incident report documents the restraint in the kitchen
when Youth A attempted to get a knife. There are no injuries
noted on the incident report.
• Bay Pines Center Restraint Policy was reviewed on
November 13, 2023. The policy states restraints should
only be used to prevent serious injury to the child, self-
injury, or injury to other and must be done in a safe manner.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with resident restraint. There is
no evidence that Youth A was injured due to being restrained by
staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162 Seclusion within secure and nonsecure
Section facilities; seclusion plan; prohibitions; reduction and
Description elimination.
(5) Staff may not use seclusion for discipline, punishment,
administrative convenience, retaliation, staffing shortages, or
reasons other than a temporary response to behavior that
threatens immediate harm to a youth or others.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
8

Allegation Youth has been locked in cell or hallway for weeks at a time in
isolation.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on October 11,
2023, and reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at Pine Rest facility, on
October 12, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth A said during his most recent placement at Bay Pines
Center he was placed in his room for three days on concussion
protocol after hitting his head on his bedroom door window. Youth
A said he was also left in his room most mornings until 9am due to
not having enough staff working, noting one incident that he was
left in his room until 1pm due to lack of staffing. Youth A said there
were many days when he was placed in his room for “hours”,
stating Staff 5, Supervisor X and Supervisor Z were the staff that
made him stay in his room. Youth A said “daytime supervisors”
would place him in his room until he would take his PRN. Youth A
said he was put in his room after having behavioral issues and
told to “reflect on it”. Youth A said Youth B, Youth C, Youth D,
Youth E, and Youth F all witnessed him being placed in his room
for long periods of time, stating all of them were also placed in
their rooms by Staff 5 for hours at a time “for no reason”. Youth A
was not able to remember exact dates of being placed in his
room, stating it happened “all the time”.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth
B said Youth A was placed at Bay Pines with her twice over the
last few years. Youth B said Youth A would be left in his room for
long periods of time depending on his behaviors. Youth B said
staff would not wake Youth A up in the morning and then when he
woke up, staff would not let him out of his room. Youth B said this
was a common occurrence. Youth B said Staff 5 would place the
youth in their rooms for a few hours at a time throughout his shift.
Youth B said she and some other youth told “administration” about
this and Staff 5 “got in trouble” and stopped putting the youth in
their rooms.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker.
Youth C said Youth A would participate on her unit while he was
placed at Bay Pines Center. Youth C said Youth A will not wake up
in time for breakfast so stays in his room while her unit goes to the
dining hall to eat. Youth C said when Youth A does wake up, he
will have to wait for an extra staff sometimes which makes him
9

mad, and he will bang and scream in his room so staff will make
him calm down before coming out of his room. Youth C said this
occurs often each week.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth D said Youth A was on her unit. Youth D said Youth A would
be kept in his room when there was no one-to-one staff for him.
Youth D said it happened “more than it should” but did not have
dates or a number of times it occurred.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth E said Youth A was placed on her unit. Youth E said Youth A
would be in his room for long periods of time in the morning
because he would be sleeping, and Staff 5 would not allow him
out of his room until another staff came into work. Youth E said
that was the only time she saw Youth A be kept in his room.
Youth F was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth F said Youth A was on her unit. Youth F said Youth A would
be put in his room when he had an “emotional outburst” and then
become upset for having to be in his room and bang on the door
and scream. Youth F said many times when Youth A became
upset he would be in the hallway or the room to keep him away
from the youth on her pod as he would threaten to hurt the other
youth. Youth F said Youth A would also be left in his room when
there was not enough staff to supervise him, stating this was
usually in the morning. Youth F said staff would allow Youth A to
sleep in because he was not allowed to be in the dining hall at
times and then bring him his breakfast and have him eat it in his
room until the other staff arrived around 9am. Youth F said most of
the time Youth A was then allowed out at 9am however at times he
would be screaming and banging on his door so staff would not let
him out until he was calm.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on October
17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Nurse said
she does not have knowledge of Youth A being in his room for
long periods of time. Nurse said the staff have been directed to
contact her, Nurse Practitioner, or the triage phone line if a youth
has a head injury and they will be directed what needs to be done
at that time.
10

Nurse Practitioner was interviewed face-to-face at the facility,
on October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Nurse Practitioner said she saw Youth A once for a concussion
due to him banging his head on a door or floor. Nurse Practitioner
said when a youth was placed on concussion protocol it would be
no television, no video games, no gym, and staff need to closely
monitor the youth’s symptoms for 24 to 48 hours. Nurse
Practitioner said she never developed a specific concussion
protocol as it may differ for each youth, and she would make
individual recommendations instead of one blanket procedure.
Nurse Practitioner said she believes the staff are using concussion
protocol as an excuse to seclude youth.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
October 17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Therapist said she is not aware of Youth A being kept in his room
for long periods of time. Therapist said Youth A’s safety plan was
for him not to be placed in his room due to that making his mental
health worse. Therapist said Youth A said bedtime was a difficult
time for him to be alone in his room. Staff would sit in Youth A’s
open doorway until he fell asleep, so he would not be locked in
until asleep.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on October
17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said
he is not aware of Youth A being kept in his room for long periods
of time. Staff 1 said Youth A would be out on the unit when he got
to work and throughout the day. Staff 1 said there were times
when Youth A would be in his hallway or in his room with the door
open due to his behaviors not being safe to be around the unit.
Staff 1 said there were times when Youth A would sleep in on the
weekends but as soon as he woke up, he would be provided his
medication and then allowed out of his room.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on October
17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said
Youth A was the only male in the facility and therefore kept on his
own unit, which was part of the detention hallway where there are
two bedrooms and a small common area/hallway. Staff 2 said
Youth A would participate during the day with Girls Group 3 so that
he was not alone however there was times when he could not be
a part of Girls Group 3 for safety reasons or staffing reasons. He
would then be on his own unit with a staff. Staff 2 said part of the
plan for Youth A to be with Girls Group 3 was to have his chair
positioned in the doorway of the swing hall and the unit due to his
unpredictable behaviors so he could be moved into his own
11

hallway somewhat quickly if needed to separate him from the
other youth. Staff 2 said Youth A was never left in his room during
her shifts.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on October
17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said
Youth A was the only male in the facility, therefore his bedroom
was in the swing hallway or detention area which only had two
bedrooms and a small hallway area. Staff 3 said Youth A would
participate with Girls Group 3 during the day and the plan was for
him to have is chair in the doorway of the swing hall and unit 3 so
that if he became upset, violent, or needed to take a break from
the group he could go right into his hallway and the door would be
shut to separate him from unit 3 youth. Staff 3 said Youth A would
always have his staff with him and he would be able to move in
and out of his room as he wanted and use the hallway to pace or
deescalate. Staff 3 said Youth A was not kept in his room for long
periods of time as it was against his safety plan and not in his best
interest.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on October
17, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 4 said
he has never witnessed or heard of Youth A being isolated or
secluded for long periods of time. Staff 4 said Youth A really was
never alone as he always had one staff assigned to him and he
was the only one on his unit so would always have a staff working
with just him. Staff 4 said Youth A has had to take breaks for short
periods of time in his room or hallway when he was out of control,
but staff would always be talking to him and allow him out as
quickly as possible.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone, on October 23, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 5 said if Youth A
showed unsafe behaviors towards himself or others he would be
placed in his room. Staff 5 said he would conduct room checks on
Youth A and each check talk with Youth A and attempt to get him
out of his “zone” and rejoin the group. Staff 5 said he would also
notify the supervisor whenever this occurred. Staff 5 said he
comes into work at 9am and Youth A would typically be out on the
unit with the other youth. Staff 5 said there were a few times when
there was not enough staff and Youth A would be in his room until
a float staff would get there to sit with him, stating these times
were usually only about 15 minutes or less. Staff 5 said he never
recalls a time when Youth A was left in his room until noon or 1pm.
Staff 5 stated he was reeducated on the expectations when youth
are placed in their rooms and that even if he must leave the pod to
12

use the bathroom, the checks must be done by a float or
supervisor. Staff 5 said there was a situation when he had the
youth go into their rooms for the maintenance person to change
out lightbulbs and he was told he should not have placed the
youth in their rooms rather he should have taken them off the unit
if he felt it would pose a safety concern.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone, on November 1, 2023,
in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 6 said he worked
from 9am until 9pm and when he arrived at work Youth A would
either be participating with the group or sitting with his one-on-one
talking in his hallway/unit area. Staff 6 said Youth A was only
